problem.p: A particle of mass m is moving with a constant velocity \(\vec{v}_o = v_o\hat{i}\). At time t = 0 it enters a region between two plates that are separated by a distance h and are contained in the x-z plane as shown in the figure. The particle is acting on by both gravity and by a time varying force that points upward (along the +y - direction) and has a magnitude F = bt, where b is a positive constant and is large enough such that the particle never touches the plates.
Part 1. Do a qualitative plot of the particle's position as a function of time. This will help you to to visualize the particle's motion and to plan your solution.
Part 2. If the particle is initially at the midpoint between the two plates (as shown in the figure above), how long does it take for the particle to reach its lowest point?
Part 3. What is the minimum possible value of b such that the particle does not hit the lower plate?
